hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Breakout via Compression Break with Options Flow Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes lasting >15 days with BTC's 10-day Bollinger Band width compressing below 0.15 (annualized), a daily close >3% above the 20-day upper Bollinger Band, accompanied by a put/call volume ratio < 0.7 on Deribit, will trigger a BULL regime transition within 3 days with high reliability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended compression in neutral regimes represents energy accumulation. A breakout with options market confirmation (low put/call ratio) indicates strong directional conviction rather than false breakout. Options traders positioning for upside suggests institutional flow alignment with technical breakout.
entry_conditions: Current regime == NEUTRAL for >15 consecutive days
BTC daily close > 1.03 * 20-day upper Bollinger Band
Deribit BTC options put/call volume ratio (5-day avg) < 0.7

exit_conditions.take_profit: 10% price increase from entry OR regime transitions to BULL (confidence > 70%)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price returns inside Bollinger Bands (closes < upper band)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 30% of breakouts fail to sustain (price re-enters bands within 3 days) OR fail to trigger BULL regime transition within 5 days.
